meanings.definition: Stupes (verb): to make someone or something stupid or dull
meanings.sent1: Watching too much TV can stupes your mind.
meanings.sent2: The boring lecture stupes the students.
meanings.sent3: The hypnotist tried to stupes the audience, but they stayed alert.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous sound of the rain stupes the city into a trance.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive tasks can slowly stupes a person over time.

meanings.definition: Stupes (noun): a stupid or dull person
meanings.sent1: Don't be a stupes and pay attention in class.
meanings.sent2: The village was full of stupes who couldn't solve simple problems.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a lovable stupes character who always made mistakes.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a stupes in a world of geniuses.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the villain as a cunning mastermind and the hero as a lovable stupes.

meanings.definition: Stupes (adjective): lacking intelligence or common sense
meanings.sent1: His stupes behavior led to many mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The stupes decision cost them the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat's stupes antics always made the family laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dark and stormy night felt strangely stupes.
meanings.sent5: The old, dusty book had a certain stupes charm to it.
